summary: The Border Operations Service Medal Act (H.R. 3780) proposes the creation of a medal to recognize the service of military members, National Guard, Reserve, and Federal personnel involved in designated border security operations. These operations, authorized by Executive Order in January 2025, encompass security, humanitarian, and enforcement efforts along the U.S.-Mexico border. The Secretary of Defense, in consultation with military service branches, will design and issue the medal, with regulations to be finalized within 60 days of the bill's enactment.
